snippet: Many Republican governors had delayed acting on the health care law in the hope of a Romney presidency that would push to overturn the law.
abstract: Obama administration, for second time in week, says it is extending deadline until mid-December for states to decide whether they will establish and operate online markets where consumers can shop for health insurance under the new health care law.
lead_paragraph: Many Republican governors had delayed acting on the health care law in the hope of a Romney presidency that would push to overturn the law.

headline.seo: States’ Deadline Extended for Insurance Exchanges
headline.main: U.S. Extends Deadline for States on Health Insurance Exchanges
headline.print_headline: U.S. Extends Deadline for States On Health Insurance Exchanges

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
